answers.answer: one of the bad things is that they have shown where putting a child on whole milk before the age of one increases their chances of later developing diabetes.  also, children that age need a lot of iron in their diet, something found in formula.  if the child is on cow's milk there is not that added iron and they greatly run the risk of becoming anemic which is life threatening.

Not to mention their immature digestive tract which can cause the baby an incredible amount of pain with their inability to process it.Allergies, diabetes (as mentioned), anemia, obesity, the list goes on and on. Way too many bad things can happen as a result.Andi

I am a Pedi Nurse Practitioner.  We warn parents not to put child on whole milk until 12 months due to the fact that whole milk doesn't have the iron and other vitamins a growing infant needs.  Also, the fat content in breast and formula milks are high and of the right content for proper brain development.  What the others list above are also correct but the main focus is the metabolism and the growth of the child at this very important stage.
